title: Squared, bold italic sans heading font
content:
Updated: Solved. Thank you to fvilanakis and kthomps5!  
-----  
Any help is greatly appreciated.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112553im_/http:/tncbusinesscards.com/text.jpg)  
 [http://tncbusinesscards.com/text.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112553/http:/tncbusinesscards.com/text.jpg)

Font: 

 Agency FB Bold with artificial italicization 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112553/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")
author: TNC

comments.content: I think it's an artificially expanded and italicized **[Agency FB (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112553/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Font-Bureau%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=AgencyFB%20-%20Bold&fid=b300e9494a03b7ac54c1e297af288762&fstyle=i&fsize=60&text=FLOORING&fit=1)** by Font Bureau [2003]

Looks like Font Bureau’s Agency Wide Bold, with some artificial italicizing:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/fb-agency/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112553/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/fb-agency/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/fb-agency/")

Agency Gothic CT would work as well (with the same italicizing, plus some widening):  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/agency-gothic-ct/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112553/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/agency-gothic-ct/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/agency-gothic-ct/")
